org.gearvrf

Interface GVRShaderManagers

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GVRBaseShaderManager, GVRMaterialShaderManager, GVRPostEffectShaderManager

    public interface GVRShaderManagers
    The API shared by GVRMaterialShaderManager and GVRPostEffectShaderManager.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • newShader

        GVRShaderId newShader(java.lang.String vertexShader,
                      java.lang.String fragmentShader)
        Builds a shader program from the supplied vertex and fragment shader code strings. This method is used internally relies upon GVRMaterialShaderId and GVRPostEffectShaderId both deriving from GVRShaderId (which was not true in earlier GearVRF releases).
        Parameters:
        vertexShader - GLSL source code for a vertex shader.
        fragmentShader - GLSL source code for a fragment shader.
        Returns:
        An opaque type that you can pass to getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId) or to the GVRMaterial andGVRPostEffect constructors and setShader methods.

      • addShader

        GVRShaderId addShader(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
                      java.lang.String vertexShader_asset,
                      java.lang.String fragmentShader_asset)
        Builds a shader program from the supplied vertex and fragment shader code. The main point of this API is 'discovery,' where you scan the asset directory (or, more typically, some particular subdirectory) looking for shader pairs that you didn't know about at compile time. Secondarily, this can be useful if you have a lot of shader pairs, and would prefer to create a folder per pair and use names like "thisShader/vertex.vsh" and "thisShader/fragment.fsh" rather than "thisShader_vertex.vsh" and "thisShader_fragment.fsh". If neither of these points apply to you, you should use res/raw, as that presents no dangers of file not found exceptions.
        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - Optional (may be null) prefix for shader filenames. If present, will be prepended to vertexShader and fragmentShader, thus allowing you to build a tree of shaders in your assets directory, where each node contains vertex and fragment shaders with the same filename. If null, vertexShader and fragmentShader are the path names of files in the assets directory.

        To be clear: the path names can contain '/' characters, whether or not pathPrefix is null. 

         
 pathPrefix = "foo"; fragmentShader = "bar/fragment.fsh"
 // Asset-relative name is "foo/bar/fragment.fsh" 
 
 pathPrefix = null; fragmentShader = "bar/fragment.fsh"
 // Asset-relative name is "bar/fragment.fsh"
        vertexShader_asset - Filename of a vertex shader, relative to the assets directory
        fragmentShader_asset - Filename of a fragment shader, relative to the assets directory
        Returns:
        An opaque type that you can pass to getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId) or to the GVRMaterial and GVRPostEffect constructors and setShader methods ... or null on any exception, which typically would mean that one or both of the files does not exist or is not readable.

      • newShader

        GVRShaderId newShader(int vertexShader_resRaw,
                      int fragmentShader_resRaw)
        Builds a shader program from the supplied vertex and fragment shader code obtained from resources in res/raw.
        Parameters:
        vertexShader_resRaw - R.raw id, for a file containing a vertex shader
        fragmentShader_resRaw - R.raw id, for a file containing a fragment shader
        Returns:
        An opaque type that you can pass to getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId) or to the GVRMaterial and GVRPostEffect constructors and setShader methods.

      • newShader

        GVRShaderId newShader(java.io.InputStream vertexShader_stream,
                      java.io.InputStream fragmentShader_stream)
        Builds a shader program from vertex and fragment shader code obtained from input streams.
        Parameters:
        vertexShader_stream - GLSL source code for a vertex shader. Stream will be closed when method returns.
        fragmentShader_stream - GLSL source code for a fragment shader. Stream will be closed when method returns.
        Returns:
        An opaque type that you can pass to getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId) or to the GVRMaterial and GVRPostEffect constructors and setShader methods.

      • getShaderMapping

        GVRShaderMaps getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId id)
        Get a name mapping object for the custom shader program.
        Parameters:
        id - Opaque type from newShader(String, String)
        Returns:
        A name mapping object
